metadata.title: CVE-2021-46966 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ACPI:custom_method: fix potential use-after-free issue In cm_write(), buf isalways freed when reaching the end of the function. If the requested countis less than table.length, the allocated buffer will be freed butsubsequent calls to cm_write() will still try to access it. Remove theunconditional kfree(buf) at the end of the function and set the buf to NULLin the -EINVAL error path to match the rest of function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46966` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-253-generic - 4.4.0-253.287
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-253-generic - 4.4.0-253.287
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-253-lowlatency - 4.4.0-253.287
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1131-kvm - 4.4.0-1131.141
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1168-aws - 4.4.0-1168.183
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-253.287').
linux-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-151.157~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1131.141').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1168.183').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1109.116~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1121.134~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1106.120~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1078.86~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
